topics.title: ErgoHack 9 Wallet Survey Project Introduction
topics.summary: ErgoMinnow introduces the Wallet Wonderland project created with CannonQ for ErgoHack 9. The project surveyed 113 Sigmanauts about wallet preferences and experiences to help design the next generation Ergo wallet.

topics.title: Current Wallet Landscape and Top Performers
topics.summary: Overview of six major Ergo wallets analyzed in the survey. Nautilus and Ergo Mobile emerged as the top-rated and most widely used wallets, with general satisfaction among users despite areas for improvement.

topics.title: Nautilus and Mobile Wallet Feature Requests
topics.summary: Survey findings show users want transaction history, in-wallet swaps, address books, and mobile version for Nautilus. Ergo Mobile users desire improved UI/UX, NFT display, and dApp integration while maintaining simplicity.

topics.title: Ultimate Ergo Wallet Feature Requirements
topics.summary: Key features identified for the ideal Ergo wallet include easy-to-use simple UI, asset and NFT support, mixer integration, and comprehensive transaction history. Mixer integration was highlighted as a game-changing feature leveraging Ergo's open-source mixer.

topics.title: Ledger Hardware Wallet Integration Issues
topics.summary: Survey revealed significant user resistance to Ledger's dev mode/sideload requirement for Ergo support. Non-tech-savvy users avoid this setup due to security concerns, creating a barrier to hardware wallet adoption.

topics.title: Survey Data Analysis and User Preferences
topics.summary: Detailed survey results show easy-to-use interface as the most important feature, with sending/receiving tokens and DEX trading as primary use cases. In-wallet token swaps emerged as the top requested feature, with multisig support also desired.

topics.title: Documentation and Wallet Comparison Resources
topics.summary: The project created comprehensive documentation including video tutorials, feature comparisons, and centralized information for all wallets. A detailed feature matrix from the Satergo team helps users compare wallet capabilities and identify development gaps.
